meanings.definition: In a way that is unwilling to spend or give freely; miserly.
meanings.sent1: She counted her coins stingily, not wanting to buy anything unnecessary.
meanings.sent2: He always tips stingily at restaurants, much to the disappointment of the servers.
meanings.sent3: The wealthy man chuckled stingily as he donated a single dollar to the charity event.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat stingily, holding onto every bit of love she had left.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes gleamed stingily as he hoarded his collection of rare stamps.

meanings.definition: In a way that is done with reluctance or in a sparing manner.
meanings.sent1: The child ate his vegetables stingily, taking tiny bites to avoid finishing them.
meanings.sent2: She spoke stingily about her past, revealing only small details at a time.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed stingily at the closed door, wanting to go outside but not too eager.
meanings.sent4: Time passed stingily, dragging its feet as if reluctant to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone stingily through the clouds, casting a faint light on the deserted street.
